00044 void bmo_makevert_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00045 {
00046     float vec[3];
00047 
00048     BMO_slot_vec_get(op, "co", vec);
00049 
00050     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, BM_vert_create(bm, vec, NULL), 1);
00051     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "newvertout", BM_VERT, 1);
00052 }
00053 
00054 void bmo_transform_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00055 {
00056     BMOIter iter;
00057     BMVert *v;
00058     float mat[4][4];
00059 
00060     BMO_slot_mat4_get(op, "mat", mat);
00061 
00062     BMO_ITER (v, &iter, bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT) {
00063         mul_m4_v3(mat, v->co);
00064     }
00065 }
00066 
00067 void bmo_translate_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00068 {
00069     float mat[4][4], vec[3];
00070     
00071     BMO_slot_vec_get(op, "vec", vec);
00072 
00073     unit_m4(mat);
00074     copy_v3_v3(mat[3], vec);
00075 
00076     BMO_op_callf(bm, "transform mat=%m4 verts=%s", mat, op, "verts");
00077 }
00078 
00079 void bmo_scale_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00080 {
00081     float mat[3][3], vec[3];
00082     
00083     BMO_slot_vec_get(op, "vec", vec);
00084 
00085     unit_m3(mat);
00086     mat[0][0] = vec[0];
00087     mat[1][1] = vec[1];
00088     mat[2][2] = vec[2];
00089 
00090     BMO_op_callf(bm, "transform mat=%m3 verts=%s", mat, op, "verts");
00091 }
00092 
00093 void bmo_rotate_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00094 {
00095     float vec[3];
00096     
00097     BMO_slot_vec_get(op, "cent", vec);
00098     
00099     /* there has to be a proper matrix way to do this, but
00100      * this is how editmesh did it and I'm too tired to think
00101      * through the math right now. */
00102     mul_v3_fl(vec, -1.0f);
00103     BMO_op_callf(bm, "translate verts=%s vec=%v", op, "verts", vec);
00104 
00105     BMO_op_callf(bm, "transform mat=%s verts=%s", op, "mat", op, "verts");
00106 
00107     mul_v3_fl(vec, -1.0f);
00108     BMO_op_callf(bm, "translate verts=%s vec=%v", op, "verts", vec);
00109 }

00112 {
00113     BMOIter siter;
00114     BMFace *f;
00115 
00116     BMO_ITER (f, &siter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00117         BM_face_normal_flip(bm, f);
00118     }
00119 }

00121 void bmo_edgerotate_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00122 {
00123     BMOIter siter;
00124     BMEdge *e, *e2;
00125     int ccw = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "ccw");
00126     int is_single = BMO_slot_buffer_count(bm, op, "edges") == 1;
00127     short check_flag = is_single ?
00128                 BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_EXISTS :
00129                 BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_EXISTS | BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_DEGENERATE;
00130 
00131 #define EDGE_OUT   1
00132 #define FACE_TAINT 1
00133 
00134     BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00138         if (BM_edge_rotate_check(e)) {
00139             BMFace *fa, *fb;
00140             if (BM_edge_face_pair(e, &fa, &fb)) {
00141 
00142                 /* check we're untouched */
00143                 if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, fa, FACE_TAINT) == FALSE &&
00144                     BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, fb, FACE_TAINT) == FALSE)
00145                 {
00146 
00147                     if (!(e2 = BM_edge_rotate(bm, e, ccw, check_flag))) {
00148 #if 0
00149                         BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_INVALID_SELECTION, "Could not rotate edge");
00150                         return;
00151 #endif
00152                         continue;
00153                     }
00154 
00155                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e2, EDGE_OUT);
00156 
00157                     /* don't touch again */
00158                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fa, FACE_TAINT);
00159                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fb, FACE_TAINT);
00160                 }
00161             }
00162         }
00163     }
00164 
00165     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "edgeout", BM_EDGE, EDGE_OUT);
00166 
00167 #undef EDGE_OUT
00168 #undef FACE_TAINT
00169 
00170 }

00172 #define SEL_FLAG    1
00173 #define SEL_ORIG    2
00174 
00175 static void bmo_regionextend_extend(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op, int usefaces)
00176 {
00177     BMVert *v;
00178     BMEdge *e;
00179     BMIter eiter;
00180     BMOIter siter;
00181 
00182     if (!usefaces) {
00183         BMO_ITER (v, &siter, bm, op, "geom", BM_VERT) {
00184             BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00185                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, SEL_ORIG))
00186                     break;
00187             }
00188 
00189             if (e) {
00190                 BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00191                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, SEL_FLAG);
00192                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, BM_edge_other_vert(e, v), SEL_FLAG);
00193                 }
00194             }
00195         }
00196     }
00197     else {
00198         BMIter liter, fiter;
00199         BMFace *f, *f2;
00200         BMLoop *l;
00201 
00202         BMO_ITER (f, &siter, bm, op, "geom", BM_FACE) {
00203             BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00204                 BM_ITER_ELEM (f2, &fiter, l->e, BM_FACES_OF_EDGE) {
00205                     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f2, SEL_ORIG)) {
00206                         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f2, SEL_FLAG);
00207                     }
00208                 }
00209             }
00210         }
00211     }
00212 }

00214 static void bmo_regionextend_constrict(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op, int usefaces)
00215 {
00216     BMVert *v;
00217     BMEdge *e;
00218     BMIter eiter;
00219     BMOIter siter;
00220 
00221     if (!usefaces) {
00222         BMO_ITER (v, &siter, bm, op, "geom", BM_VERT) {
00223             BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00224                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, SEL_ORIG))
00225                     break;
00226             }
00227 
00228             if (e) {
00229                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, SEL_FLAG);
00230 
00231                 BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00232                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, SEL_FLAG);
00233                 }
00234 
00235             }
00236         }
00237     }
00238     else {
00239         BMIter liter, fiter;
00240         BMFace *f, *f2;
00241         BMLoop *l;
00242 
00243         BMO_ITER (f, &siter, bm, op, "geom", BM_FACE) {
00244             BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00245                 BM_ITER_ELEM (f2, &fiter, l->e, BM_FACES_OF_EDGE) {
00246                     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f2, SEL_ORIG)) {
00247                         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, SEL_FLAG);
00248                         break;
00249                     }
00250                 }
00251             }
00252         }
00253     }
00254 }

00256 void bmo_regionextend_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00257 {
00258     int use_faces = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_faces");
00259     int constrict = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "constrict");
00260 
00261     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "geom", BM_ALL, SEL_ORIG);
00262 
00263     if (constrict)
00264         bmo_regionextend_constrict(bm, op, use_faces);
00265     else
00266         bmo_regionextend_extend(bm, op, use_faces);
00267 
00268     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "geomout", BM_ALL, SEL_FLAG);
00269 }
00270 
00271 /********* righthand faces implementation ****** */
00272 
00273 #define FACE_VIS    1
00274 #define FACE_FLAG   2
00275 #define FACE_MARK   4
00276 #define FACE_FLIP   8
00277 
00278 /* NOTE: these are the original righthandfaces comment in editmesh_mods.c,
00279  *       copied here for reference. */
00280 
00281 /* based at a select-connected to witness loose objects */
00282 
00283 /* count per edge the amount of faces
00284  * find the ultimate left, front, upper face (not manhattan dist!!)
00285  * also evaluate both triangle cases in quad, since these can be non-flat
00286  *
00287  * put normal to the outside, and set the first direction flags in edges
00288  *
00289  * then check the object, and set directions / direction-flags: but only for edges with 1 or 2 faces
00290  * this is in fact the 'select connected'
00291  *
00292  * in case (selected) faces were not done: start over with 'find the ultimate ...' */
00293 
00294 /* NOTE: this function uses recursion, which is a little unusual for a bmop
00295  *       function, but acceptable I think. */
00296 
00297 /* NOTE: BM_ELEM_TAG is used on faces to tell if they are flipped. */
00298 
00299 void bmo_righthandfaces_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00300 {
00301     BMIter liter, liter2;
00302     BMOIter siter;
00303     BMFace *f, *startf, **fstack = NULL;
00304     BLI_array_declare(fstack);
00305     BMLoop *l, *l2;
00306     float maxx, maxx_test, cent[3];
00307     int i, maxi, flagflip = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "do_flip");
00308 
00309     startf = NULL;
00310     maxx = -1.0e10;
00311     
00312     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE, FACE_FLAG);
00313 
00314     /* find a starting face */
00315     BMO_ITER (f, &siter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00316 
00317         /* clear dirty flag */
00318         BM_elem_flag_disable(f, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00319 
00320         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, FACE_VIS))
00321             continue;
00322 
00323         if (!startf) startf = f;
00324 
00325         BM_face_calc_center_bounds(f, cent);
00326 
00327         if ((maxx_test = dot_v3v3(cent, cent)) > maxx) {
00328             maxx = maxx_test;
00329             startf = f;
00330         }
00331     }
00332 
00333     if (!startf) return;
00334 
00335     BM_face_calc_center_bounds(startf, cent);
00336 
00337     /* make sure the starting face has the correct winding */
00338     if (dot_v3v3(cent, startf->no) < 0.0f) {
00339         BM_face_normal_flip(bm, startf);
00340         BMO_elem_flag_toggle(bm, startf, FACE_FLIP);
00341 
00342         if (flagflip)
00343             BM_elem_flag_toggle(startf, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00344     }
00345     
00346     /* now that we've found our starting face, make all connected faces
00347      * have the same winding.  this is done recursively, using a manual
00348      * stack (if we use simple function recursion, we'd end up overloading
00349      * the stack on large meshes). */
00350 
00351     BLI_array_growone(fstack);
00352     fstack[0] = startf;
00353     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, startf, FACE_VIS);
00354 
00355     i = 0;
00356     maxi = 1;
00357     while (i >= 0) {
00358         f = fstack[i];
00359         i--;
00360 
00361         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00362             BM_ITER_ELEM (l2, &liter2, l, BM_LOOPS_OF_LOOP) {
00363                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l2->f, FACE_FLAG) || l2 == l)
00364                     continue;
00365 
00366                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l2->f, FACE_VIS)) {
00367                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, l2->f, FACE_VIS);
00368                     i++;
00369                     
00370                     if (l2->v == l->v) {
00371                         BM_face_normal_flip(bm, l2->f);
00372                         
00373                         BMO_elem_flag_toggle(bm, l2->f, FACE_FLIP);
00374                         if (flagflip)
00375                             BM_elem_flag_toggle(l2->f, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00376                     }
00377                     else if (BM_elem_flag_test(l2->f, BM_ELEM_TAG) || BM_elem_flag_test(l->f, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00378                         if (flagflip) {
00379                             BM_elem_flag_disable(l->f, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00380                             BM_elem_flag_disable(l2->f, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00381                         }
00382                     }
00383                     
00384                     if (i == maxi) {
00385                         BLI_array_growone(fstack);
00386                         maxi++;
00387                     }
00388 
00389                     fstack[i] = l2->f;
00390                 }
00391             }
00392         }
00393     }
00394 
00395     BLI_array_free(fstack);
00396 
00397     /* check if we have faces yet to do.  if so, recurse */
00398     BMO_ITER (f, &siter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00399         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, FACE_VIS)) {
00400             bmo_righthandfaces_exec(bm, op);
00401             break;
00402         }
00403     }
00404 }
00405 
00406 void bmo_vertexsmooth_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00407 {
00408     BMOIter siter;
00409     BMIter iter;
00410     BMVert *v;
00411     BMEdge *e;
00412     BLI_array_declare(cos);
00413     float (*cos)[3] = NULL;
00414     float *co, *co2, clipdist = BMO_slot_float_get(op, "clipdist");
00415     int i, j, clipx, clipy, clipz;
00416     
00417     clipx = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "mirror_clip_x");
00418     clipy = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "mirror_clip_y");
00419     clipz = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "mirror_clip_z");
00420 
00421     i = 0;
00422     BMO_ITER (v, &siter, bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT) {
00423         BLI_array_growone(cos);
00424         co = cos[i];
00425         
00426         j  = 0;
00427         BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00428             co2 = BM_edge_other_vert(e, v)->co;
00429             add_v3_v3v3(co, co, co2);
00430             j += 1;
00431         }
00432         
00433         if (!j) {
00434             copy_v3_v3(co, v->co);
00435             i++;
00436             continue;
00437         }
00438 
00439         mul_v3_fl(co, 1.0f / (float)j);
00440         mid_v3_v3v3(co, co, v->co);
00441 
00442         if (clipx && fabsf(v->co[0]) <= clipdist)
00443             co[0] = 0.0f;
00444         if (clipy && fabsf(v->co[1]) <= clipdist)
00445             co[1] = 0.0f;
00446         if (clipz && fabsf(v->co[2]) <= clipdist)
00447             co[2] = 0.0f;
00448 
00449         i++;
00450     }
00451 
00452     i = 0;
00453     BMO_ITER (v, &siter, bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT) {
00454         copy_v3_v3(v->co, cos[i]);
00455         i++;
00456     }
00457 
00458     BLI_array_free(cos);
00459 }
00460 
00461 /*
00462  * compute the fake surface of an ngon
00463  * This is done by decomposing the ngon into triangles who share the centroid of the ngon
00464  * while this method is far from being exact, it should guarantee an invariance.
00465  *
00466  * NOTE: This should probably go to bmesh_polygon.c
00467  */
00468 static float ngon_fake_area(BMFace *f)
00469 {
00470     BMIter  liter;
00471     BMLoop *l;
00472     int     num_verts = 0;
00473     float   v[3], sv[3], c[3];
00474     float   area = 0.0f;
00475 
00476     BM_face_calc_center_mean(f, c);
00477 
00478     BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00479         if (num_verts == 0) {
00480             copy_v3_v3(v, l->v->co);
00481             copy_v3_v3(sv, l->v->co);
00482             num_verts++;
00483         }
00484         else {
00485             area += area_tri_v3(v, c, l->v->co);
00486             copy_v3_v3(v, l->v->co);
00487             num_verts++;
00488         }
00489     }
00490 
00491     area += area_tri_v3(v, c, sv);
00492 
00493     return area;
00494 }
00495 
00496 /*
00497  * extra face data (computed data)
00498  */
00499 typedef struct SimSel_FaceExt {
00500     BMFace  *f;             /* the face */
00501     float    c[3];          /* center */
00502     union {
00503         float   area;       /* area */
00504         float   perim;      /* perimeter */
00505         float   d;          /* 4th component of plane (the first three being the normal) */
00506         struct Image *t;    /* image pointer */
00507     };
00508 } SimSel_FaceExt;
00509 
00510 /*
00511  * Select similar faces, the choices are in the enum in source/blender/bmesh/bmesh_operators.h
00512  * We select either similar faces based on material, image, area, perimeter, normal, or the coplanar faces
00513  */
00514 void bmo_similarfaces_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00515 {
00516     BMIter fm_iter;
00517     BMFace *fs, *fm;
00518     BMOIter fs_iter;
00519     int num_sels = 0, num_total = 0, i = 0, idx = 0;
00520     float angle = 0.0f;
00521     SimSel_FaceExt *f_ext = NULL;
00522     int *indices = NULL;
00523     float t_no[3];  /* temporary normal */
00524     int type = BMO_slot_int_get(op, "type");
00525     float thresh = BMO_slot_float_get(op, "thresh");
00526 
00527     num_total = BM_mesh_elem_count(bm, BM_FACE);
00528 
00529     /*
00530      * The first thing to do is to iterate through all the the selected items and mark them since
00531      * they will be in the selection anyway.
00532      * This will increase performance, (especially when the number of originaly selected faces is high)
00533      * so the overall complexity will be less than $O(mn)$ where is the total number of selected faces,
00534      * and n is the total number of faces
00535      */
00536     BMO_ITER (fs, &fs_iter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00537         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, fs, FACE_MARK)) {   /* is this really needed ? */
00538             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fs, FACE_MARK);
00539             num_sels++;
00540         }
00541     }
00542 
00543     /* allocate memory for the selected faces indices and for all temporary faces */
00544     indices = (int *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(int) * num_sels, "face indices util.c");
00545     f_ext = (SimSel_FaceExt *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(SimSel_FaceExt) * num_total, "f_ext util.c");
00546 
00547     /* loop through all the faces and fill the faces/indices structure */
00548     BM_ITER_MESH (fm, &fm_iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00549         f_ext[i].f = fm;
00550         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, fm, FACE_MARK)) {
00551             indices[idx] = i;
00552             idx++;
00553         }
00554         i++;
00555     }
00556 
00557     /*
00558      * Save us some computation burden: In case of perimeter/area/coplanar selection we compute
00559      * only once.
00560      */
00561     if (type == SIMFACE_PERIMETER || type == SIMFACE_AREA || type == SIMFACE_COPLANAR || type == SIMFACE_IMAGE) {
00562         for (i = 0; i < num_total; i++) {
00563             switch (type) {
00564                 case SIMFACE_PERIMETER:
00565                     /* set the perimeter */
00566                     f_ext[i].perim = BM_face_calc_perimeter(f_ext[i].f);
00567                     break;
00568 
00569                 case SIMFACE_COPLANAR:
00570                     /* compute the center of the polygon */
00571                     BM_face_calc_center_mean(f_ext[i].f, f_ext[i].c);
00572 
00573                     /* normalize the polygon normal */
00574                     copy_v3_v3(t_no, f_ext[i].f->no);
00575                     normalize_v3(t_no);
00576 
00577                     /* compute the plane distance */
00578                     f_ext[i].d = dot_v3v3(t_no, f_ext[i].c);
00579                     break;
00580 
00581                 case SIMFACE_AREA:
00582                     f_ext[i].area = ngon_fake_area(f_ext[i].f);
00583                     break;
00584 
00585                 case SIMFACE_IMAGE:
00586                     f_ext[i].t = NULL;
00587                     if (CustomData_has_layer(&(bm->pdata), CD_MTEXPOLY)) {
00588                         MTexPoly *mtpoly = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->pdata, f_ext[i].f->head.data, CD_MTEXPOLY);
00589                         f_ext[i].t = mtpoly->tpage;
00590                     }
00591                     break;
00592             }
00593         }
00594     }
00595 
00596     /* now select the rest (if any) */
00597     for (i = 0; i < num_total; i++) {
00598         fm = f_ext[i].f;
00599         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, fm, FACE_MARK)  && !BM_elem_flag_test(fm, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00600             int cont = TRUE;
00601             for (idx = 0; idx < num_sels && cont == TRUE; idx++) {
00602                 fs = f_ext[indices[idx]].f;
00603                 switch (type) {
00604                     case SIMFACE_MATERIAL:
00605                         if (fm->mat_nr == fs->mat_nr) {
00606                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fm, FACE_MARK);
00607                             cont = FALSE;
00608                         }
00609                         break;
00610 
00611                     case SIMFACE_IMAGE:
00612                         if (f_ext[i].t == f_ext[indices[idx]].t) {
00613                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fm, FACE_MARK);
00614                             cont = FALSE;
00615                         }
00616                         break;
00617 
00618                     case SIMFACE_NORMAL:
00619                         angle = RAD2DEGF(angle_v3v3(fs->no, fm->no));   /* if the angle between the normals -> 0 */
00620                         if (angle / 180.0f <= thresh) {
00621                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fm, FACE_MARK);
00622                             cont = FALSE;
00623                         }
00624                         break;
00625 
00626                     case SIMFACE_COPLANAR:
00627                         angle = RAD2DEGF(angle_v3v3(fs->no, fm->no)); /* angle -> 0 */
00628                         if (angle / 180.0f <= thresh) { /* and dot product difference -> 0 */
00629                             if (fabsf(f_ext[i].d - f_ext[indices[idx]].d) <= thresh) {
00630                                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fm, FACE_MARK);
00631                                 cont = FALSE;
00632                             }
00633                         }
00634                         break;
00635 
00636                     case SIMFACE_AREA:
00637                         if (fabsf(f_ext[i].area - f_ext[indices[idx]].area) <= thresh) {
00638                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fm, FACE_MARK);
00639                             cont = FALSE;
00640                         }
00641                         break;
00642 
00643                     case SIMFACE_PERIMETER:
00644                         if (fabsf(f_ext[i].perim - f_ext[indices[idx]].perim) <= thresh) {
00645                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, fm, FACE_MARK);
00646                             cont = FALSE;
00647                         }
00648                         break;
00649                 }
00650             }
00651         }
00652     }
00653 
00654     MEM_freeN(f_ext);
00655     MEM_freeN(indices);
00656 
00657     /* transfer all marked faces to the output slot */
00658     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "faceout", BM_FACE, FACE_MARK);
00659 }
00660 
00661 /**************************************************************************** *
00662  * Similar Edges
00663  **************************************************************************** */
00664 #define EDGE_MARK 1
00665 
00666 /*
00667  * extra edge information
00668  */
00669 typedef struct SimSel_EdgeExt {
00670     BMEdge *e;
00671     union {
00672         float dir[3];
00673         float angle;            /* angle between the face */
00674     };
00675 
00676     union {
00677         float length;           /* edge length */
00678         int   faces;            /* faces count */
00679     };
00680 } SimSel_EdgeExt;
00681 
00682 /*
00683  * select similar edges: the choices are in the enum in source/blender/bmesh/bmesh_operators.h
00684  * choices are length, direction, face, ...
00685  */
00686 void bmo_similaredges_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00687 {
00688     BMOIter es_iter;    /* selected edges iterator */
00689     BMIter e_iter;      /* mesh edges iterator */
00690     BMEdge *es;     /* selected edge */
00691     BMEdge *e;      /* mesh edge */
00692     int idx = 0, i = 0 /* , f = 0 */;
00693     int *indices = NULL;
00694     SimSel_EdgeExt *e_ext = NULL;
00695     // float *angles = NULL;
00696     float angle;
00697 
00698     int num_sels = 0, num_total = 0;
00699     int type = BMO_slot_int_get(op, "type");
00700     float thresh = BMO_slot_float_get(op, "thresh");
00701 
00702     num_total = BM_mesh_elem_count(bm, BM_EDGE);
00703 
00704     /* iterate through all selected edges and mark them */
00705     BMO_ITER (es, &es_iter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00706         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, es, EDGE_MARK);
00707         num_sels++;
00708     }
00709 
00710     /* allocate memory for the selected edges indices and for all temporary edges */
00711     indices = (int *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(int) * num_sels, "indices util.c");
00712     e_ext = (SimSel_EdgeExt *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(SimSel_EdgeExt) * num_total, "e_ext util.c");
00713 
00714     /* loop through all the edges and fill the edges/indices structure */
00715     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &e_iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00716         e_ext[i].e = e;
00717         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, EDGE_MARK)) {
00718             indices[idx] = i;
00719             idx++;
00720         }
00721         i++;
00722     }
00723 
00724     /* save us some computation time by doing heavy computation once */
00725     if (type == SIMEDGE_LENGTH || type == SIMEDGE_FACE || type == SIMEDGE_DIR || type == SIMEDGE_FACE_ANGLE) {
00726         for (i = 0; i < num_total; i++) {
00727             switch (type) {
00728                 case SIMEDGE_LENGTH:    /* compute the length of the edge */
00729                     e_ext[i].length = len_v3v3(e_ext[i].e->v1->co, e_ext[i].e->v2->co);
00730                     break;
00731 
00732                 case SIMEDGE_DIR:       /* compute the direction */
00733                     sub_v3_v3v3(e_ext[i].dir, e_ext[i].e->v1->co, e_ext[i].e->v2->co);
00734                     break;
00735 
00736                 case SIMEDGE_FACE:      /* count the faces around the edge */
00737                     e_ext[i].faces = BM_edge_face_count(e_ext[i].e);
00738                     break;
00739 
00740                 case SIMEDGE_FACE_ANGLE:
00741                     e_ext[i].faces = BM_edge_face_count(e_ext[i].e);
00742                     if (e_ext[i].faces == 2)
00743                         e_ext[i].angle = BM_edge_calc_face_angle(e_ext[i].e);
00744                     break;
00745             }
00746         }
00747     }
00748 
00749     /* select the edges if any */
00750     for (i = 0; i < num_total; i++) {
00751         e = e_ext[i].e;
00752         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, EDGE_MARK) && !BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00753             int cont = TRUE;
00754             for (idx = 0; idx < num_sels && cont == TRUE; idx++) {
00755                 es = e_ext[indices[idx]].e;
00756                 switch (type) {
00757                     case SIMEDGE_LENGTH:
00758                         if (fabsf(e_ext[i].length - e_ext[indices[idx]].length) <= thresh) {
00759                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00760                             cont = FALSE;
00761                         }
00762                         break;
00763 
00764                     case SIMEDGE_DIR:
00765                         /* compute the angle between the two edges */
00766                         angle = RAD2DEGF(angle_v3v3(e_ext[i].dir, e_ext[indices[idx]].dir));
00767 
00768                         if (angle > 90.0f) /* use the smallest angle between the edges */
00769                             angle = fabsf(angle - 180.0f);
00770 
00771                         if (angle / 90.0f <= thresh) {
00772                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00773                             cont = FALSE;
00774                         }
00775                         break;
00776 
00777                     case SIMEDGE_FACE:
00778                         if (e_ext[i].faces == e_ext[indices[idx]].faces) {
00779                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00780                             cont = FALSE;
00781                         }
00782                         break;
00783 
00784                     case SIMEDGE_FACE_ANGLE:
00785                         if (e_ext[i].faces == 2) {
00786                             if (e_ext[indices[idx]].faces == 2) {
00787                                 if (fabsf(e_ext[i].angle - e_ext[indices[idx]].angle) <= thresh) {
00788                                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00789                                     cont = FALSE;
00790                                 }
00791                             }
00792                         }
00793                         else {
00794                             cont = FALSE;
00795                         }
00796                         break;
00797 
00798                     case SIMEDGE_CREASE:
00799                         if (CustomData_has_layer(&bm->edata, CD_CREASE)) {
00800                             float *c1, *c2;
00801 
00802                             c1 = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->edata, e->head.data, CD_CREASE);
00803                             c2 = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->edata, es->head.data, CD_CREASE);
00804 
00805                             if (c1 && c2 && fabsf(*c1 - *c2) <= thresh) {
00806                                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00807                                 cont = FALSE;
00808                             }
00809                         }
00810                         break;
00811 
00812                     case SIMEDGE_SEAM:
00813                         if (BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_SEAM) == BM_elem_flag_test(es, BM_ELEM_SEAM)) {
00814                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00815                             cont = FALSE;
00816                         }
00817                         break;
00818 
00819                     case SIMEDGE_SHARP:
00820                         if (BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_SMOOTH) == BM_elem_flag_test(es, BM_ELEM_SMOOTH)) {
00821                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, EDGE_MARK);
00822                             cont = FALSE;
00823                         }
00824                         break;
00825                 }
00826             }
00827         }
00828     }
00829 
00830     MEM_freeN(e_ext);
00831     MEM_freeN(indices);
00832 
00833     /* transfer all marked edges to the output slot */
00834     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "edgeout", BM_EDGE, EDGE_MARK);
00835 }
00836 
00837 /**************************************************************************** *
00838  * Similar Vertices
00839  **************************************************************************** */
00840 #define VERT_MARK   1
00841 
00842 typedef struct SimSel_VertExt {
00843     BMVert *v;
00844     union {
00845         int num_faces; /* adjacent faces */
00846         MDeformVert *dvert; /* deform vertex */
00847     };
00848 } SimSel_VertExt;
00849 
00850 /*
00851  * select similar vertices: the choices are in the enum in source/blender/bmesh/bmesh_operators.h
00852  * choices are normal, face, vertex group...
00853  */
00854 void bmo_similarverts_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00855 {
00856     BMOIter vs_iter;    /* selected verts iterator */
00857     BMIter v_iter;      /* mesh verts iterator */
00858     BMVert *vs;     /* selected vertex */
00859     BMVert *v;          /* mesh vertex */
00860     SimSel_VertExt *v_ext = NULL;
00861     int *indices = NULL;
00862     int num_total = 0, num_sels = 0, i = 0, idx = 0;
00863     int type = BMO_slot_int_get(op, "type");
00864     float thresh = BMO_slot_float_get(op, "thresh");
00865 
00866     num_total = BM_mesh_elem_count(bm, BM_VERT);
00867 
00868     /* iterate through all selected edges and mark them */
00869     BMO_ITER (vs, &vs_iter, bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT) {
00870         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, vs, VERT_MARK);
00871         num_sels++;
00872     }
00873 
00874     /* allocate memory for the selected vertices indices and for all temporary vertices */
00875     indices = (int *)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(int) * num_sels, "vertex indices");
00876     v_ext = (SimSel_VertExt *)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(SimSel_VertExt) * num_total, "vertex extra");
00877 
00878     /* loop through all the vertices and fill the vertices/indices structure */
00879     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &v_iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00880         v_ext[i].v = v;
00881         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK)) {
00882             indices[idx] = i;
00883             idx++;
00884         }
00885 
00886         switch (type) {
00887             case SIMVERT_FACE:
00888                 /* calling BM_vert_face_count every time is time consumming, so call it only once per vertex */
00889                 v_ext[i].num_faces = BM_vert_face_count(v);
00890                 break;
00891 
00892             case SIMVERT_VGROUP:
00893                 if (CustomData_has_layer(&(bm->vdata), CD_MDEFORMVERT)) {
00894                     v_ext[i].dvert = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->vdata, v_ext[i].v->head.data, CD_MDEFORMVERT);
00895                 }
00896                 else {
00897                     v_ext[i].dvert = NULL;
00898                 }
00899                 break;
00900         }
00901 
00902         i++;
00903     }
00904 
00905     /* select the vertices if any */
00906     for (i = 0; i < num_total; i++) {
00907         v = v_ext[i].v;
00908         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK) && !BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00909             int cont = TRUE;
00910             for (idx = 0; idx < num_sels && cont == TRUE; idx++) {
00911                 vs = v_ext[indices[idx]].v;
00912                 switch (type) {
00913                     case SIMVERT_NORMAL:
00914                         /* compare the angle between the normals */
00915                         if (RAD2DEGF(angle_v3v3(v->no, vs->no)) / 180.0f <= thresh) {
00916                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, VERT_MARK);
00917                             cont = FALSE;
00918                         }
00919                         break;
00920                     case SIMVERT_FACE:
00921                         /* number of adjacent faces */
00922                         if (v_ext[i].num_faces == v_ext[indices[idx]].num_faces) {
00923                             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, VERT_MARK);
00924                             cont = FALSE;
00925                         }
00926                         break;
00927 
00928                     case SIMVERT_VGROUP:
00929                         if (v_ext[i].dvert != NULL && v_ext[indices[idx]].dvert != NULL) {
00930                             int v1, v2;
00931                             for (v1 = 0; v1 < v_ext[i].dvert->totweight && cont == 1; v1++) {
00932                                 for (v2 = 0; v2 < v_ext[indices[idx]].dvert->totweight; v2++) {
00933                                     if (v_ext[i].dvert->dw[v1].def_nr == v_ext[indices[idx]].dvert->dw[v2].def_nr) {
00934                                         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, VERT_MARK);
00935                                         cont = FALSE;
00936                                         break;
00937                                     }
00938                                 }
00939                             }
00940                         }
00941                         break;
00942                 }
00943             }
00944         }
00945     }
00946 
00947     MEM_freeN(indices);
00948     MEM_freeN(v_ext);
00949 
00950     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "vertout", BM_VERT, VERT_MARK);
00951 }
00952 
00953 /**************************************************************************** *
00954  * Cycle UVs for a face
00955  **************************************************************************** */
00956 
00957 void bmo_face_rotateuvs_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00958 {
00959     BMOIter fs_iter;    /* selected faces iterator */
00960     BMFace *fs; /* current face */
00961     BMIter l_iter;  /* iteration loop */
00962     // int n;
00963 
00964     int dir = BMO_slot_int_get(op, "dir");
00965 
00966     BMO_ITER (fs, &fs_iter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00967         if (CustomData_has_layer(&(bm->ldata), CD_MLOOPUV)) {
00968             if (dir == DIRECTION_CW) { /* same loops direction */
00969                 BMLoop *lf; /* current face loops */
00970                 MLoopUV *f_luv; /* first face loop uv */
00971                 float p_uv[2];  /* previous uvs */
00972                 float t_uv[2];  /* tmp uvs */
00973 
00974                 int n = 0;
00975                 BM_ITER_ELEM (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00976                     /* current loop uv is the previous loop uv */
00977                     MLoopUV *luv = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPUV);
00978                     if (n == 0) {
00979                         f_luv = luv;
00980                         copy_v2_v2(p_uv, luv->uv);
00981                     }
00982                     else {
00983                         copy_v2_v2(t_uv, luv->uv);
00984                         copy_v2_v2(luv->uv, p_uv);
00985                         copy_v2_v2(p_uv, t_uv);
00986                     }
00987                     n++;
00988                 }
00989 
00990                 copy_v2_v2(f_luv->uv, p_uv);
00991             }
00992             else if (dir == DIRECTION_CCW) { /* counter loop direction */
00993                 BMLoop *lf; /* current face loops */
00994                 MLoopUV *p_luv; /* previous loop uv */
00995                 MLoopUV *luv;
00996                 float t_uv[2];  /* current uvs */
00997 
00998                 int n = 0;
00999                 BM_ITER_ELEM (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
01000                     /* previous loop uv is the current loop uv */
01001                     luv = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPUV);
01002                     if (n == 0) {
01003                         p_luv = luv;
01004                         copy_v2_v2(t_uv, luv->uv);
01005                     }
01006                     else {
01007                         copy_v2_v2(p_luv->uv, luv->uv);
01008                         p_luv = luv;
01009                     }
01010                     n++;
01011                 }
01012 
01013                 copy_v2_v2(luv->uv, t_uv);
01014             }
01015         }
01016     }
01017 
01018 }
01019 
01020 /**************************************************************************** *
01021  * Reverse UVs for a face
01022  **************************************************************************** */
01023 
01024 void bmo_face_reverseuvs_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
01025 {
01026     BMOIter fs_iter;    /* selected faces iterator */
01027     BMFace *fs;     /* current face */
01028     BMIter l_iter;      /* iteration loop */
01029     BLI_array_declare(uvs);
01030     float (*uvs)[2] = NULL;
01031 
01032     BMO_ITER (fs, &fs_iter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
01033         if (CustomData_has_layer(&(bm->ldata), CD_MLOOPUV)) {
01034             BMLoop *lf; /* current face loops */
01035             int i;
01036 
01037             BLI_array_empty(uvs);
01038             BLI_array_growitems(uvs, fs->len);
01039 
01040             BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, i) {
01041                 MLoopUV *luv = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPUV);
01042 
01043                 /* current loop uv is the previous loop uv */
01044                 copy_v2_v2(uvs[i], luv->uv);
01045             }
01046 
01047             /* now that we have the uvs in the array, reverse! */
01048             i = 0;
01049             BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, i) {
01050                 /* current loop uv is the previous loop uv */
01051                 MLoopUV *luv = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPUV);
01052                 copy_v2_v2(luv->uv, uvs[(fs->len - i - 1)]);
01053             }
01054         }
01055     }
01056 
01057     BLI_array_free(uvs);
01058 }
01059 
01060 /**************************************************************************** *
01061  * Cycle colors for a face
01062  **************************************************************************** */
01063 
01064 void bmo_rotatecolors_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
01065 {
01066     BMOIter fs_iter;    /* selected faces iterator */
01067     BMFace *fs; /* current face */
01068     BMIter l_iter;  /* iteration loop */
01069     // int n;
01070 
01071     int dir = BMO_slot_int_get(op, "dir");
01072 
01073     BMO_ITER (fs, &fs_iter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
01074         if (CustomData_has_layer(&(bm->ldata), CD_MLOOPCOL)) {
01075             if (dir == DIRECTION_CW) { /* same loops direction */
01076                 BMLoop *lf; /* current face loops */
01077                 MLoopCol *f_lcol; /* first face loop color */
01078                 MLoopCol p_col; /* previous color */
01079                 MLoopCol t_col; /* tmp color */
01080 
01081                 int n = 0;
01082                 BM_ITER_ELEM (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
01083                     /* current loop color is the previous loop color */
01084                     MLoopCol *luv = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPCOL);
01085                     if (n == 0) {
01086                         f_lcol = luv;
01087                         p_col = *luv;
01088                     }
01089                     else {
01090                         t_col = *luv;
01091                         *luv = p_col;
01092                         p_col = t_col;
01093                     }
01094                     n++;
01095                 }
01096 
01097                 *f_lcol = p_col;
01098             }
01099             else if (dir == DIRECTION_CCW) { /* counter loop direction */
01100                 BMLoop *lf; /* current face loops */
01101                 MLoopCol *p_lcol; /* previous loop color */
01102                 MLoopCol *lcol;
01103                 MLoopCol t_col; /* current color */
01104 
01105                 int n = 0;
01106                 BM_ITER_ELEM (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
01107                     /* previous loop color is the current loop color */
01108                     lcol = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPCOL);
01109                     if (n == 0) {
01110                         p_lcol = lcol;
01111                         t_col = *lcol;
01112                     }
01113                     else {
01114                         *p_lcol = *lcol;
01115                         p_lcol = lcol;
01116                     }
01117                     n++;
01118                 }
01119 
01120                 *lcol = t_col;
01121             }
01122         }
01123     }
01124 }
01125 
01126 /*************************************************************************** *
01127  * Reverse colors for a face
01128  *************************************************************************** */
01129 
01130 void bmo_face_reversecolors_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
01131 {
01132     BMOIter fs_iter;    /* selected faces iterator */
01133     BMFace *fs;     /* current face */
01134     BMIter l_iter;      /* iteration loop */
01135     BLI_array_declare(cols);
01136     MLoopCol *cols = NULL;
01137 
01138     BMO_ITER (fs, &fs_iter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
01139         if (CustomData_has_layer(&(bm->ldata), CD_MLOOPCOL)) {
01140             BMLoop *lf; /* current face loops */
01141             int i;
01142 
01143             BLI_array_empty(cols);
01144             BLI_array_growitems(cols, fs->len);
01145 
01146             BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, i) {
01147                 cols[i] = *((MLoopCol *)CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPCOL));
01148             }
01149 
01150             /* now that we have the uvs in the array, reverse! */
01151             BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX (lf, &l_iter, fs, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, i) {
01152                 /* current loop uv is the previous loop color */
01153                 MLoopCol *lcol = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, lf->head.data, CD_MLOOPCOL);
01154                 *lcol = cols[(fs->len - i - 1)];
01155             }
01156         }
01157     }
01158 
01159     BLI_array_free(cols);
01160 }
01161 
01162 
01163 /*************************************************************************** *
01164  * shortest vertex path select
01165  *************************************************************************** */
01166 
01167 typedef struct ElemNode {
01168     BMVert *v;  /* vertex */
01169     BMVert *parent; /* node parent id */
01170     float weight;   /* node weight */
01171     HeapNode *hn;   /* heap node */
01172 } ElemNode;
01173 
01174 void bmo_vertexshortestpath_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
01175 {
01176     BMOIter vs_iter /* , vs2_iter */;   /* selected verts iterator */
01177     BMIter v_iter;      /* mesh verts iterator */
01178     BMVert *vs, *sv, *ev;   /* starting vertex, ending vertex */
01179     BMVert *v;      /* mesh vertex */
01180     Heap *h = NULL;
01181 
01182     ElemNode *vert_list = NULL;
01183 
01184     int num_total = 0 /*, num_sels = 0 */, i = 0;
01185     int type = BMO_slot_int_get(op, "type");
01186 
01187     BMO_ITER (vs, &vs_iter, bm, op, "startv", BM_VERT) {
01188         sv = vs;
01189     }
01190     BMO_ITER (vs, &vs_iter, bm, op, "endv", BM_VERT) {
01191         ev = vs;
01192     }
01193 
01194     num_total = BM_mesh_elem_count(bm, BM_VERT);
01195 
01196     /* allocate memory for the nodes */
01197     vert_list = (ElemNode *)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(ElemNode) * num_total, "vertex nodes");
01198 
01199     /* iterate through all the mesh vertices */
01200     /* loop through all the vertices and fill the vertices/indices structure */
01201     i = 0;
01202     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &v_iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
01203         vert_list[i].v = v;
01204         vert_list[i].parent = NULL;
01205         vert_list[i].weight = FLT_MAX;
01206         BM_elem_index_set(v, i); /* set_inline */
01207         i++;
01208     }
01209     bm->elem_index_dirty &= ~BM_VERT;
01210 
01211     /*
01212      * we now have everything we need, start Dijkstra path finding algorithm
01213      */
01214 
01215     /* set the distance/weight of the start vertex to 0 */
01216     vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(sv)].weight = 0.0f;
01217 
01218     h = BLI_heap_new();
01219 
01220     for (i = 0; i < num_total; i++) {
01221         vert_list[i].hn = BLI_heap_insert(h, vert_list[i].weight, vert_list[i].v);
01222     }
01223 
01224     while (!BLI_heap_empty(h)) {
01225         BMEdge *e;
01226         BMIter e_i;
01227         float v_weight;
01228 
01229         /* take the vertex with the lowest weight out of the heap */
01230         BMVert *v = (BMVert *)BLI_heap_popmin(h);
01231 
01232         if (vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(v)].weight == FLT_MAX) /* this means that there is no path */
01233             break;
01234 
01235         v_weight = vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(v)].weight;
01236 
01237         BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &e_i, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
01238             BMVert *u;
01239             float e_weight = v_weight;
01240 
01241             if (type == VPATH_SELECT_EDGE_LENGTH)
01242                 e_weight += len_v3v3(e->v1->co, e->v2->co);
01243             else e_weight += 1.0f;
01244 
01245             u = (e->v1 == v) ? e->v2 : e->v1;
01246 
01247             if (e_weight < vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(u)].weight) { /* is this path shorter ? */
01248                 /* add it if so */
01249                 vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(u)].parent = v;
01250                 vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(u)].weight = e_weight;
01251 
01252                 /* we should do a heap update node function!!! :-/ */
01253                 BLI_heap_remove(h, vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(u)].hn);
01254                 BLI_heap_insert(h, e_weight, u);
01255             }
01256         }
01257     }
01258 
01259     /* now we trace the path (if it exists) */
01260     v = ev;
01261 
01262     while (vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(v)].parent != NULL) {
01263         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, VERT_MARK);
01264         v = vert_list[BM_elem_index_get(v)].parent;
01265     }
01266 
01267     BLI_heap_free(h, NULL);
01268     MEM_freeN(vert_list);
01269 
01270     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "vertout", BM_VERT, VERT_MARK);
01271 }
Generated on Tue Nov 13 2012 11:54:05 for Blender by  doxygen 1.7.4
